Chronic CO2 retention with chronic metabolic alkalosis with 
acute decompensation from volume overload, possibly with 
underlying infection, heart failure, lung cancer. Likely poor 
substrate i/s/o lung cancer. Required emergent intubation on the 
floor prior to transfer to ___, later extubated but still 
requiring face tent or BiPAP. Received 7 days of abx tx and 
Lasix gtt with minimal urine output given rising Cr. CXR showed 
bilateral pleural effusions which were drained by IP placement 
of R pigtail on ___ L on ___. Unfortunately, patient's 
hypoxemia did not improve. Her code status was changed to 
DNR/DNI after her family determined that she would not want 
additional aggressive treatments. She expired on ___. 

#Non-Convulsive Status Epilepticus
#Toxic metabolic encephalopathy
Patient with mild confusion on ___ with progression of 
encephalopathy found to be somnolent and minimally responsive on 
morning of ___. Labs were stable and head CT was negative. 
Repeat UA negative. EEG was applied and concerning 
non-convulsive status epilepticus. She was given ativan 3mg IV x 
2 and started on keppra for the seizures. Unclear cause of 
seizures, differential includes infection (less likely), 
metabolic alkalosis (although appears stable), medications 
(possibly cefepime), underlying metastases (none on recent brain 
MRI). Possibly complicating mental status is hypoxia, 
hypercarbia,  delirium, uremia with rising Cr and declining UOP. 
Mental status waxing/waning, but overall slowly improving. Brain 
MRI w/ and w/o contrast showed some meningeal enhancement. 
Paraneoplastic antibody panel negative. 
She was continued on keppra, renally dosed per neurology. 

#ATN
Rising Cr, baseline Cr 0.6-0.8. ATN secondary to renal ischemia 
and possibly sepsis. Urine with muddy brown casts. She was 
treated with Lasix gtt with diuril boluses (for her pulmonary 
edema); these were stopped per renal recommendations. Her Cr 
continued to rise with minimal urine output. Her family and HCP 
decided that dialysis was not within her GOC. 

#Anemia
Thought to be secondary to chemotherapy. Fibrinogen/haptoglobin 
not indicative of consumption. Her CBC was monitored.

#Atrial Fibrillation
CHADS2VASC 5+
Continued IV heparin in setting of rising Cr. Heparin gtt was 
stopped on ___ to focus on comfort care.

Overall stable for past month however unclear etiology. Thought 
to be component of diuresis, volume contraction, and possibly 
hypokalemia. She was given dose of acetazolamide on ___. 
Concern for possible ___ syndrome given metabolic 
alkalosis and hypokalemia possibly from ACTH-secreting tumor.
